alert.note: Alert for Lac qui Parle (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:40PM CDT until April 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... West BR Lac qui Parle River at Dawson affecting Lac qui Parle County. .Snow melt from warm temperatures has caused river levels to rise rapidly. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West BR Lac qui Parle River at Dawson. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 39.7 feet, Water surface hits Diagonial St Bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 37.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 39.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 39.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 38.2 feet on 04/25/2018. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
